conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m especially drawn to your academic environment and would be excited to contribute actively to the community. If admitted, I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_E and Student_B), applying now gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before seats fill. I will emphasize fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they have discretion among close candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We appreciate your commitment to enroll if admitted and look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order: E > B > C > D > A. In this round, applicants are Student_C and Student_A. Student_C ranks higher than Student_A, so if I must choose between them now, C is preferable. However, Student_E (my top choice) and Student_B (second) may apply later: Student_E lists School_B last, so unlikely to apply unless rejected elsewhere; Student_B lists School_B second and may apply if not accepted by School_A. If I accept Student_C now, I lose the chance to take Student_B later. But there is no option to defer with [TALK] because Student_C sent [APPLY] and I must [ACCEPT]/[REJECT]. Given Student_C states School_B is first choice and will commit, and uncertainty that Student_B will become available, accept Student_C to secure a high-ranked match rather than risk ending with lower-ranked Student_A or vacancy.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the chance to join your community and would gladly accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce any slim chance further, and applying now is still my best shot to reach the highest possible school on my preference list. If rejected, I can move to my next choices in later rounds.

conversation.message:

We appreciate your consideration of School_B and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (Remaining Quota: 0) with Student_C from an earlier accept. Per rules, if quota is 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of priority. Student_A is also lower than Student_C on our true priority list, so even with capacity we would keep Student_C. Therefore, reject Student_A.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I’d be a strong fit for your community. I would like to formally apply and commit to enrolling if accepted.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). With capacity 1, applying now risks an immediate rejection if higher-priority students apply. School_A is my 3rd choice and ranks me 1st, so an [APPLY] to School_A should be accepted and locks in a strong outcome. I will secure School_A rather than gamble for School_C/D where my priority is weaker.
